fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44890].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The idea behind it is that for large enterprise with many different types of projects and workflows, I would like to avoid long lists of roles on the project administration page many of which are irrelevant for the project. The business reason behind this request is to better support large enterprise -wide Jira instances with many projects of different characteristics and workflows.

h3. Suggested Solution
Roles can be checked as 'global' to be visible in all projects, or unchecked as 'global' to be visible only in projects associated with schemes that use the role.

Detailed steps:
When adding or editing a Project role,
!1_1.png|thumbnail!
it should be possible to mark a role as ‘Global’ or not. When ‘Global’ is checked, the current Jira behavior is used: the role is listed on the Administration > Roles page of all projects on the Jira instance
!2_2.png|thumbnail!
When ’Global’ is unchecked, the role is listed only on the Administration > Roles page of projects associated with the schemes that use the role, as viewable by the ‘ View Usage’ function.
!3_3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: I want Roles specific to projects associated with the schemes where the role is used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44889].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition
* At this moment, bulk set start date of multiple sprints is not possible.
* Admins need to start sprints manually one by one.
* Inefficient, and takes a lot of time.
* This feature would be useful in case users want to set all Sprints related to a project to start at a specific time.
!srpint.png|thumbnail!

h2. Suggested Solution
* To enable JIRA to be able to configure the start date of multiple sprints in one go.
fields.summary: As an admin I'd like to Bulk set start date of multiple Sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44885].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
When a filter is marked as favorite, the "star" icon right its name turns into black and when the filter is not the star is empty. Actually it can lead to a wrong interpretation and users need to hover the mouse above the icon to properly understand if the filter is already marked as favorite or not.
!favorite-filter-black-star.png!

h4. Suggestion
Use a golden star to indicate whether a filter is marked as favorite or not.
!favorite-filter-golden-star.png!
fields.summary: Improve visual indication when a filter is marked as favorite

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44879].
  {panel}

I pasted few cells from excel to jira.
The result was unexpectable.

It inserted table as a small image like !s1.png! , that is really inconvenient.

I expected something like
|cell1|cell2|
|another cell1|another cell2|
fields.summary: Jira adds tables in comments as pictures
New Report - Count of versions released for a give project for the current year

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44875].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

_Anonymous made transition_ is shown on +transition+ tab, instead of the user name.
 The issue is occurring only for users that have had their username changed.

+Transition+ tab is provided by [Suite Utilities for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities/cloud/overview] add-on.


h3. Environment
 * JIRA Server


h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Change a user's username
 # Transition an issue with the user you renamed in step 1


h3. Expected Results

The name of the user who transitioned the issue should be shown


h3. Actual Results

The tab transition shows "Anonymous" instead of the user name


h3. Workaround

Name the user back to the original username or alternatively check the 'history' tab for the name of the person that executed the transition.
fields.summary: Renamed users transitioning an issue causes transition tab to show 'Anonymous' users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44874].
  {panel}

In the project overview (or Agile board) clicking the _Actions_ button then selecting the _More Actions..._ option opens up the _Operations_ box which lets you perform certain issue operations on the selected issue.
However if one of these operations have a word containing a dash, searching for the word after the dash doesn't return the desired operation.

I can search for the Create/Convert Sub-Task action by typing _sub_, but I can't find it if I type _task_.
This also happens for workflow operations. If I have a step called _start-progress_ I can search for it typing _start_ but I can't if I type _progress_.

See screenshots for details.
fields.summary: Operations box should show words preceded by a dash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44871].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition
* Issue commented event are unable to be fired if commented in a transition screen.
* If comment field exist in a transition screen, only the transition event will be fired, and user will only receive the transition notification, leaving out the issue was commented during the transition.
* This is because it can't fire an event that tells listeners: "this issue has been modified, it includes a change on the assignee, a change in the priority, and also a new comment". 

h2. Suggested Solution
* To enable JIRA to have an event that trigger all the necessary event that happens during a transition.
fields.summary: Issue commented event are unable to be fired if commented in a transition screen
Scheduled re-index

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44863].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
Using the *Agile Version Report* dashboard gadget, it will have empty list for *Version*

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Add *Agile Version Report* dashboard gadget
# Choose the board
# Choose the version

h4. Expected Result
Version menu will list down the existing version for the chosen board

h4. Actual Result
Version list is empty, for all boards
!bugfisrt.png|thumbnail!

h4. Additional Information:
* Reproducible in *JIRA 6.4.10* & *JIRA Agile 6.7.7* and *JIRA 6.4.10* & *JIRA Agile 6.7.11*
* Not Reproducible in *JIRA 6.4.6* & *JIRA Agile 6.7.11*
fields.summary: Agile Version Report (Dashboard Gadget) does not list down Version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44854].
  {panel}

The Change Summary field in the JIRA Audit log for a new project being created is "Project created". The Change Summary field for a new project version being created is "Project version created".

When I use the JIRA Audit Log search box and type "Project created", I get results for both "Project created" and "Project version created". I expected to see only the "Project created" entries, not both. I tried using quotes around the string but then no entries are found. 

If there is some way to search more selectively then please update the documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Auditing+in+JIRA
If not, then please note that as well.
fields.summary: Cannot search for just "Project creation" entries in JIRA Audit Log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44851].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin I want my project administrators to have bulk edit permission but I do not want them to be able to import from CSV.

I can limit them from importing from other formats using global permissions but there is no option to limit the bulk edit create: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer

I still wish them to have permission to create issues, just not bulk create.

h3. Suggested Solution
Separate out the permission for importing from CSV.

h3. Workaround 
To create multiple user accounts with different permissions.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to stop users with bulk edit permission from importing from csv
JETI - fold/unfold bodytext for emails shown at issue
API Requests on Behalf of a User
Sub tasks in service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44842].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition
On later version of JIRA, when a user moved an issue it also moved all the sub tasks without having to confirm. However, on newer version of JIRA 6.4.x, the users are prompted to verify the move for each sub tasks along with the original issue. And user will need to manually configure for all the subtasks

h2. Suggested Solution
To introduce the option to automatically move the subtask along with the task without having to configure and goes to a default configuration on the new project
fields.summary: To introduce ability to validate all subtask when moving tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44841].
  {panel}

Is it possible to show the display name instead of username of the user picker field in the create/edit masks?

Our users have problems with the usernames because the usernames in our company are very cryptic and they want to see the displayname.

It would be great if we can switch the field mode into display name.
Kind Regards
Elke
fields.summary: Please show Display Name in User Picker field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44837].

I'm running JIRA 7 64 bit preview installer on Windows 7 64 bit. It finishes successfully, but the service does not start. Seems like it cannot load JAVA VM. The commons-daemon log has the following in it:
[2015-08-11 18:49:26] [info]  [ 1744] Commons Daemon procrun (1.0.15.0 32-bit) started
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [info]  [ 1744] Running 'JIRA110815114435' Service...
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [info]  [  876] Starting service...
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [error] [  876] %1 is not a valid Win32 application.
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [error] [  876] Failed creating java C:\PROGRA~1\ATLASS~1\JIRA\bin\\..\jre\bin\server\jvm.dll
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [error] [  876] %1 is not a valid Win32 application.
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [error] [  876] ServiceStart returned 1
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [error] [  876] %1 is not a valid Win32 application.
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [info]  [ 1744] Run service finished.
[2015-08-11 18:49:27] [info]  [ 1744] Commons Daemon procrun finished

There is nothing interesting in other logs,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44824].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you create a pie chart from a project in JIRA then the project name appears in the title, however if you create it from a saved filter it shows JQL query in the chart title instead of the name.  This makes it difficult to differentiate between charts. 

This functionality appeared in JIRA prior to version 6.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a saved filter
# Create a pie chart on the dashboard from the filter

h3. Expected Results
The title should be the name of the filter.
h3. Actual Results
The title is "JQL search"
 
h3.Workaround
{panel}
(i) This workaround only works specifically for the Atlassian Server platform 
{panel}
Use the {{jira-gadgets-plugin-6.4.9.jar}} file (available in a 6.4.9 version of the JIRA installation zip) to replace the 6.4.10/6.4.11 gadgets JAR file in {{$JIRA_INSTALL_DIR/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/}} folder. 

JIRA Version 6.4.9 can be downloaded from our archive: https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-archives
fields.summary: Pie charts do not show filter name in title
Error when clicking on "Assignee" drop-down
Option to Accept remote API calls missing / gone / vanished

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44820].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When using JIRA's built-in reports, only Project Pivot Report has the ability to choose from "additional fields", a custom field that is a text field (single line).

For example, in the Pie Chart Report, we are limited to a certain type of field under Statistic Type. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-42249. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Are there plans to expand the built-in reports to include more reports that have the opportunity to use a custom text field?

In our work flow, we create fill-in forms in SharePoint that passes the field’s information through to JIRA. The SharePoint field is a drop down selection, control in SharePoint. It passes the text through to a JIRA text Field (single line).

We would like to include custom fields of all types in reporting options. Project Pivot Report is the only report we can find that does this. We know that we can create a filter and export to excel. To the average user, the built-in reports are very handy and visually pleasing to use. We also know that these fields will limitations, depending upon how the field is used in a report and what’s in the field.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Cloud admin, I want the ability to choose additional fields for all reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44818].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Customers need the following plugin install to make their tasks easier:

https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.wittified.jira.project-creator
fields.summary: Bundle the The Project Creator For Jira Plugin in OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44817].
  {panel}

Dave Meyer asked us to file the following suggestion regarding a new feature that was added to JIRA 7 EAP:

In the list of JIRA 7 EAP [platform changes|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/latest-updates/preparing-for-jira-7-0/jira-7-0-platform-changes], the docs suggest that we will need to use a new BundleContext class in JIRA 7 onward.

I have a question and a suggestion:

a) Is this change already published in JIRA 7.0.0-m01b? Our add-on is seemingly working on that version of JIRA without making any changes (and using the old BundleContext).

b) Is there any way that JIRA 7 could continue to ship an shim interface corresponding to the old BundleContext (org.osgi.framework.BundleContext), and have that shimmed interface simply extend the new Eclipse BundleContext? It seems like this would permit add-ons to continue to list the old interface without any further difficulties.

This otherwise presents a significant binary compatibility problem for add-ons between JIRA 6 and 7. The current method used to get a BundleContext requires us to mark our own classes as implementors of the above interface…but if we list the new class in our JAR, it won’t load on JIRA 6 because the class doesn’t exist. If we continue to list the old class, but JIRA 7 removes it, then our JAR won’t load in JIRA 7. Although I haven’t thought through all of the classloader specifics, I think the above solution would make this very easy on everybody.

We’ve been able to resolve most issues like this through reflection, but we don’t have that option here because it’s related to the class inheritance, and it happens before our add-on gets control. Is there anything you can do?
fields.summary: Make JIRA 7 BundleContext backwards-compatible
Permit add-ons to suppress "Dangerous use of multiple connections" warnings in ConnectionPoolHealthSqlInterceptor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44815].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The 'delete' application link in the Application Link management screen is poor. The X that is used to delete applications is not clearly in it's own column, so it looks like it's related to the Action it shares a column with.
For example, in the attached screenshot, the X looks associated with the Edit action for crucible-dev 1 and with the Make Primary action for crucible-prv1-preview.
!ApplinkManagement.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the UI.
fields.summary: The delete button in Application link Screen is unclear

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44814].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary 

Attempting to restore a backup from JIRA Cloud (latest version: 7.0.0-OD-01-193) to JIRA 6.4.8 or 6.4.10 always throws the following error.
{quote}The file you are trying to import is from JIRA 7.0.0-OD-01-193, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. The import file claims it can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.4.8 or later.

If JIRA 6.4.8 is not yet available for download, please contact support.{quote}.

*Resolution*
This was a data problem, and the data has been fixed for all existing customers.

If you had previously hit this problem, please do a new export and import from that new file.

*Exception*
If you have created a new Cloud instance in the last few days, then you may still hit this error when migrating from Cloud to Server.
If this effects you then raise a support ticket and let our support team help you out.
That is, new instances created betweend
fields.summary: Can't Restore JIRA Cloud Backup on JIRA Server

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44810].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Editing any Sub-Tasks would replace the Description Field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Sub-Task administration (/secure/admin/subtasks/ManageSubTasks.jspa)
# Use Edit operation (secure/admin/subtasks/EditSubTaskIssueTypes!default.jspa)
# Check the {{Description}} field.

h3. Expected Results
The Description field should be maintained to the value it was before the *edit* button was clicked.

h3. Actual Results
The Description field is replaced automatically by JIRA with the name of the sub-task
 
h3. Notes
Tested in FF 39, Chrome 44
fields.summary: Editing a subtask issue type replaces its description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44809].
  {panel}

When exporting a set of issues as a Workload Pie Chart and there is no work logged for the issues in the set, an error message is shown that has a typo. The attached image shows the message.

It says "It seems there no work logged for these issues. I can only generate this report if there is work logged."

It should say "It seems there {color:red}*is*{color} no work logged for these issues. I can only generate this report if there is work logged."

To reproduce:
# Filter for a set of JIRA issues in which no work is logged
# Click Export->Charts
# Scroll down to "Workload Pie Chart"
# Click on "Workload Pie Chart"
# Observe the incorrect text.
fields.summary: Typo in Workload Pie Chart message
User's language set to -1 by default, causing error for date picker.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44803].
  {panel}

When Jira sees a Git commit with a string matching a known issue, it correctly highlights those commits in the development section on the appropriate ticket (see first attachment).

When the Activity stream renders those commits, however, it doesn't link to the ticket if the ticket reference isn't the very first string in the commit message (see second attachment).

It would be *fantastic* to get all ticket references converted to links in the activity stream.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Activity stream doesn't link to issues from commits consistently
JIRA API disabling users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44795].
  {panel}

Hi, 
Our customers loves Jira but often their mailbox is the main todo-list during the day. This is of course sad to say but until we have covered ALL business processes at the customers site this will continue to be the reality for many users.   

As such I would like to suggest a function to unwatch a ticket without having to click on issue link and logging into Jira. 

A link, a button, a reply in the notification...I probably don't have the best idea on the HOW but I know that the function would be appreciated.
fields.summary: Unwatch Issue through replying on notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44784].
  {panel}

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Configure JIRA and Confluence to run over SSL and create an Applinks between them
# Create a Confluence Page with a Comma, colon, or parenthesis in its Title e.g. "Hello, this is a page" or "Hello: This is a page"
# From JIRA View Issue screen -> More -> Link -> Confluence Page -> search for the above page -> Link

h4. +Expected behavior+
The Page can be linked without problem

h4. +Actual behavior+
The Page can't be linked and the following error is thrown:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.link.confluence.LinkConfluencePage.getPageId(LinkConfluencePage.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.link.confluence.LinkConfluencePage.doValidation(LinkConfluencePage.java:79)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:391)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:88)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:225)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.service(JiraWebworkActionDispatcher.java:152)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:727)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:303)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:208)
	at org.apache.tomcat.websocket.server.WsFilter.doFilter(WsFilter.java:52)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:241)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:208)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.steps.ChainedFilterStepRunner.doFilter(ChainedFilterStepRunner.java:87)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:241)

h4. +Note+
If Confluence runs over HTTP, the Page can be linked without problem.

h4. +Workaround+
# Temporarily remove the Comma from the Page Title before linking, then edit the Page title to add the Comma back
# Use JIRA Macros to mention the JIRA Issue in the Confluence Page
fields.summary: NPE linking to Confluence Page with a Comma, colon, or parenthesis in Page Title over SSL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44783].
  {panel}

h4. Description
When SSO is enabled, user details are not logged on JIRA. 
This is possible to work-around upon enabling User access logging settings to get this information out of JIRA and then search on these results on the logs, however it is not something achievable via the user interface.

h4 Suggestion 
Log user details and show through the web interface, as any other internal directory user.
fields.summary: Log user access details when SSO is configured on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44778].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition
* In the Map Fields screen of the CSV import wizard, the fields are being shown as localized field names. This can cause confusion because the localized names are ambiguous, i.e. the localization can apply to more than one field.

h3. Suggested Solution
* To have an option for user to be able to show the fields, "Display Field Names in Localized Fashion" or "Display Raw Field Names" or something to that effect.
fields.summary: Fields in Map Fields Screen of CSV Import Wizard is showing localized field name
Make ordering for tab in issue detail based on user preference
In Context Filtering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44774].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If the default reporter (with *Create Issues* permission) is set, then people who don't have a JIRA user account can create issues through email. Users in JIRA who don't have *Create Issues* permission can't create issues. The problem is, how is it that people who are not users are able to create issues however, JIRA users without *Create Issues* permission cannot at the least create issues as Default Reporter.

h3. Suggested Solution
If JIRA users don't have *Create Issues* permissions, then the issues are created as Default Reporter.
fields.summary: As a user without create user permission, I should be able to create issues as Default Reporter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44773].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If the default reporter (with *Create Issues* permission) is set, then people who don't have a JIRA user account can create issues through email. Users in JIRA who don't have *Create Issues* permission can't create issues. The problem is, how is it that people who are not users are able to create issues however, JIRA users without *Create Issues* permission cannot at the least create issues as Default Reporter.

h3. Suggested Solution
If JIRA users don't have *Create Issues* permissions, then the issues are created as Default Reporter.
fields.summary: As a user without Create Issue Permission, I should be able to create issues as Default Reporter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44772].
  {panel}

The (experimental) JIRA REST api for issue properties has operations to:
* list all property names
* get the value of a single property
* delete a single property
* update/set a single property

What I really miss is the possibility to return *all properties including their values* in one single call in order to avoid the overhead of many single calls.
This possibility could also be resolved by adding another expand option "properties" to the search api via jql which will list all the properties including their values.
fields.summary: Property REST API improvements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44771].
  {panel}

The (experimental) JIRA REST api for issue properties has operations to:
* list all property names
* get the value of a single property
* delete a single property
* update/set a single property

What I really miss is the possibility to return *all properties including their values* in one single call in order to avoid the overhead of many single calls.
This possibility could also be resolved by adding another expand option "properties" to the search api via jql which will list all the properties including their values.
fields.summary: Property REST API improvements
Index Document Configuration: Define indexed properties dynamically
cannot paste new password when resetting
{time} markup for automatic localization of date and time stamps.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44757].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When an issue is created, and *Reporter* is changed to someone other than the creator, any email notifications sent about the issue creation will display the reporter as the creator. You can check the history to verify the true creator of an issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the ability to map which field should be used to show in email notifications as the creator. Some users may want to keep reporter, others may not.
fields.summary: Issue created by... in email notifications reflects Reporter and not Creator
SmartPower3
TEST

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44746].
  {panel}

Hello,

For code-development, I prefer using Ultimate Edition of IntelliJ Idea, which is a licensed product. A new commercial license costs $499, while an individual one costs $199 (per year, I believe). 

Starting Thursday, July 30th, I have been using 30-day Free Trial of Ultimate Edition, which will expire on August 29th. Please let me know if we can get a commercial license.

Thank you!
Arpan
fields.summary: IntelliJ Idea license
JIRA should not allow creating more users than we have licenses for

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44737].
  {panel}

When you try to create an application link from JIRA to another application, JIRA opens a  menu confirming my selection. 

Source and the destination applications are reversed. i.e. when i try to connect jira to fisheye the menu on JIRA says you are trying to create a link from fisheye to JIRA.

Can the sequence please be fixed.

See screenshot attached.

PS: Can the second attachment please be deleted, it was uploaded by accident.
fields.summary: Application link menu is incorrect
Ability to Change the Email Content for Notifications per Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44734].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for additional platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here.|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44734]

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Microsoft has begun providing [previews of SQL Server 2016|http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/server-cloud/products/sql-server-2016/].
h3. Expected Results

JIRA Should be supported against Generally Available releases of Databases that have been supported on previous versions.
h3. Notes

[http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/evalcenter/evaluate-sql-server-2016] For Microsoft SQL 2016 Evaluation information.

{panel:title=(i) Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3}
Microsoft SQL Server 2016 is generally available.
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Support for Microsoft SQL Server 2016
Improve error when workflow has missing add-on

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44728].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, I would like the option to select multiple screens or workflows to delete, instead of having to delete each one individually.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement checkboxes to allow mass selection then deletion of screens or workflows.
 
h3. Workaround 
Delete each screen or workflow individually.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the option to delete multiple screens or workflows
As a JIRA Admin, I would like to get the "total number of licenses" through the REST api.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44725].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Not able to see the popup to navigate to detail list on clicking the pie chart. Especially on dashboard where there are many pie chart but if there is one or two we were able to click on the detail level from the pie chart. This is happenig only in IE but not in chrome

h3. Environment
JIRA cloud on IE on dashboard with lots of pie charts. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the dashboard > Click on the detail list for a pie chart.

h3. Expected Results
Open the detail box.

h3. Actual Results

h3.Workaround
Use another browser.
fields.summary: Not able to see the popup to navigate to detail list on clicking the pie chart on IE
Atlassian Public Maven Repository Unavailable for Download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44720].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When creating/editing an issue, a description can be seen to explain the use of the field. However, there isn't any description in the View Issue screen.

h3. Suggestion
Add Tooltips to the fields in the View Issue screen. This way, users can just hover their mouse over any field and read the description of the field
fields.summary: Add Tooltip to System/Custom fields in the View Issue Screen
Two options of the Link dialog could be grammatically reviewed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44717].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
According to some calendars, Saturday is the first day of the week. However, is currently  not possible to choose Saturday as the first day of the week in JIRA. The only options available are Sunday and Monday.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow administrators to choose Saturday as the first day of the week. 

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Set Saturday as first day of the week
Agile Board Mgmt - Different Issue details views depending on Project or Issue type.
Ability to search history of the labels fields
Documentation/recommendation on deploying JIRA Data Center in AWS
Unable to filter by "Updated By"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44700].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a developer using the REST APIs, I can create and add a field to a screen using the REST APIS.  However I cannot add or modify the field's context via an API.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please allow REST API access to this functionality.
 
h3. Workaround 
Create via the JIRA interface.
fields.summary: As a developer, I would like a REST API to set a field's context
Lock Top Navigation Bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44690].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
Users are unable to assign issues when '_Assign Issues_' and '_Assignable User_' permission are already in place, users are not able to identify the lack of *Browse User* permission when trying to assign issues.
!Screen Shot 2015-08-07 at 2.54.17 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. ***Suggestion***
Improve '*JIRA Permission Helper*' to show the reliance of 'Assignable User' with 'Browse User'

h3. ***Workaround***
Ensure that users assigning the issue has the Assign Issues and Browse Users permission.
fields.summary: Reliance of 'Assignable User' with 'Browse User'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44688].
  {panel}

I have a board with swimlanes based on due date.
1. Due today
duedate <= now()

2. Due next working day
(duedate = endOfDay("+1d") OR (duedate = endOfDay("+2d") AND duedate = startOfWeek("+7d")) OR (duedate = endOfDay("+3d") AND duedate = startOfWeek("+8d")))

For 2, it works as needed, but I'd like to be able to just do "duedate = endOfDay("+1wd") to indicate "plus one working day".  My current setup won't work well for holidays, even though I can add specific days as holidays within JIRA, for example.
fields.summary: Add "working day" to JQL filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44687].
  {panel}

As a project manager I want to be able to have consistent bug reports with reproductions step, expected result, etc.
I need to somehow create a template, whether it is inserted in the editor or in system setttings for field default values I dont care,
I can not do it in jira cloud!
There are hacks in self-hosted jira. Can you that ability to Jira cloud?\

Thanks
fields.summary: Jira cloud: Set default description field values for issue type bug in a project
E-mail notification after user import process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44680].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary:
When a user specifies an email in the catch email and sends in an email with the specified email in the catch section added into BCC field of the email that is being sent to JIRA.

An issue would not be created, despite the catch email being added to one of the fields mentioned.

{quote}
If specified, only email messages whose To:, Cc:, Bcc: lines contain the recipient specified in this field will be processed — for example, issues@mycompany.com

Upon specifying an address here, all email messages whose To:, Cc:, Bcc: lines contain addresses other than the Catch Email Address are ignored. This is useful if you have multiple aliases for the same mail account (e.g. foo-support@example-co.com and bar-support@example-co.com aliases for support@example-co.com) for multiple mail services (e.g. each one to create issues in separate JIRA projects).

(info) Note: in practice, this option is rarely useful and should not be confused with the more common Default Reporter. You can only specify one catch email address and one issue type per mail handler.
{quote}

Steps to reproduce:
- Configuring an incoming mail handler.
- Add in the catch email.
- Create an issue via email adding in the specified catch email to the BCC field.
- Send the email and check if an issue is created.

*Expected Result*
- Issue is created in JIRA

*Actual Result*
- No Issue is created

*Error in Logs*
{noformat}
Cannot handle message.  No recipient addresses found.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Issues created via email when catch mail specified in BCC fail to be created
How can I remove the none option from a cascade field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44677].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary
When an issue us shared using the “Share this issue by emailing other users”, we would like the opportunity to search for such issues in the issue navigator page.

h5. Suggested Fix
Add a field to track shared issues. Users can then search for issues based on the fields value.
fields.summary: Add Ability to search for shared issues to JQL
JIRA should be compatible with the upcoming 5.7 release of MySQL
JIRA is not working for my whole team

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44667].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When trying to select which columns to display, a list of a columns ending with the line "xx more options. Continue typing to refine further." Where xx is the number of options that are not displayed. It is not possible to know what the "more options" are, since it is not displayed and the only way to know what they are is to refine the search.

 !Screenshot from 2016-01-22 21-13-33_censored (1).jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
The "xx more options" should be a link to a full list of the "more options", either as a popup window or a new page.
fields.summary: Unable to view a complete list of columns to display/search/sort by even when there are many of them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44659].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Change filter permanently.

!Screen Shot 2015-08-05 at 11.24.40 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
-
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a project
# Click on _Issues_
# Click on _Change filter_
# Select a new filter
# Open any other page then go back to _Issues_ view
#* The filter will be _Open Issues_ and you'll have to change it once again

h3. Expected Results
The _Issues_ view will show the selected filter unless the user changed it

h3. Actual Results
The default filter is _Open Issues_

h3. Notes
-
h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Remember last filter in embedded issue navigator
Change JIRA Users description
